Title: Who Can be Your AI Doctor?: Evaluation for Disease diagnosis on Large Language Models
Abstract: large language models  large language model  have demonstrated outstanding performance in general domain knowledge inference such as arithmetic reasoning commonsense reasoning and open domain question answering. traditional large language model were mainly developed and serviced by big tech companies as commercial making it nearly impossible for researchers to access parameters. however the recent emergence of non commercial large language model has led to ongoing research efforts to surpass commercial large language model in specific areas using task specific or domain specific large language model. in this study among many tasks or domains we focus on the high level knowledge demanding medical domain particularly automatic diagnosis system  ads . we evaluated whether current representative large language model can perform disease diagnosis effectively and whether they have the potential to assist doctors in clinical situations. moreover we also observe the overall quality of responses to whether each large language model can accurately diagnose based on understanding the patient‚äôs basic information such as age sex underlying diseases and family history and explore whether non commercial large language model are likely to outperform commercial large language model in ads.
